Posts.Content: tracyg121 wrote: Hi.  I am new to this community.  I am 37yr old and am a nervous wreck about developing breast cancer.  My mother and grandmother (her mother) died of breast cancer.  I have been VERY proactive with exams.  I have had a mammogram every year since I was 30.  Because of my family history, a surgeon advised me to have a breast MRI.  I had one in May which concluded probable fibrocystic changes, repeat in 6 months.  I had a repeat MRI last week and everything looks the same as the one in May.  There was some slight enhancement that is probable fiborcystic changes.  There are two places in each breast that were enhanced that they feel are fibrocystic.  I can also feel them and they have not changed since May.  Recommendation was to have repeat MRI in 6 months.  The stress of waiting is killing me!!!  I am so scared because the kind of cancer my mom had (10 years ago) never did show up on a mammogram and they had her wait six months.  The places that I feel in one breast I can feel the same thickening in the other breast.  I went to the surgeon's office last week for him to feel it and he said that it felt like fatty glandular tissue. Anyone else have some advice or similar experience?  My gut tells me it is probably nothing but I am scared that I am going to die and leave my 9yr old dd without a mother...... TIA Tracy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast MRI results tracyg121 TenderIsOurMight
